job.name: Azure_Create_Event_Hub

variable.description: The subscription id of your Microsoft Azure account.
variable.name: SUBSCRIPTION_ID

variable.description: The tenant id of your Microsoft Azure account.
variable.name: TENANT_ID

variable.description: ID of a Azure client application.
variable.name: APP_ID

variable.description: Secret key needed to access the Azure client application.
variable.name: PASSWORD

variable.description: Hidden variable that contains the authentication endpoint of Azure REST API.
variable.name: AUTHENTICATION_ENDPOINT

variable.description: Hidden variable that contains the REST endpoint for managing Azure resources.
variable.name: MANAGEMENT_ENDPOINT

variable.description: The name of the Resource Group where the Event Hub will be created. If the value of this variable is changed, it must be also changed in the workflow 'Azure_Delete_Event_Hub'.
variable.name: RESOURCE_GROUP_NAME

variable.description: The region of Azure Cloud where the Resource Group will be created
variable.name: RESOURCE_GROUP_LOCATION

variable.description: The name of the Namespace where the Event Hub will be created. If the value of this variable is changed, it must be also changed in the workflow 'Azure_Delete_Event_Hub'.
variable.name: NAMESPACE

variable.description: Name of the Event Hub to be created.
variable.name: EVENT_HUB_NAME

job.description: A workflow that uses Azure REST API to deploy a Event Hub. Once the hub is deployed successfully, the workflow waits for a user action/signal to undeploy it.

task.name: ad_token_for_event_hub
task.description: A task performing a POST request to Azure REST API in order to authenticate to Azure and acquire an authentication token.

variable.description: Base URL of the server or service that will be queried.
variable.name: ENDPOINT

variable.description: Path of the request (relative to the base url)
variable.name: PATH

variable.description: If true, disable SSL certificate verification
variable.name: SSL_DISABLE_CHECK

variable.description: Content-Type of the request
variable.name: CONTENT_TYPE

variable.description: A JSON parameter containing the request body.
variable.name: REQUEST_BODY

variable.description: If true, print the full request and response content in the task output.
variable.name: DEBUG

variable.description:
Format of the response, either:
  • string: plain text
  • json: a json response which will be parsed using RESPONSE_PATH
  • xml: a xml response which will be parsed using RESPONSE_PATH
  • html
    • : an html response which will be parsed using RESPONSE_PATH
  • contentView: the response will be stored in raw format, and the response content-type will be used for previewing (suitable for binary formats such as files, images, pdf documents, etc)
variable.name: RESPONSE_FORMAT

variable.description: Which data to extract in the response if json, xml or html format is selected. It uses the GPath notation
variable.name: RESPONSE_PATH

script.code:
def jarFile = new File(cachespace, "rest-assured-fat-3.3.0.jar")
forkEnvironment.addAdditionalClasspath(jarFile.getAbsolutePath())

import groovy.json.*
// =========== Manage Azure Access token ============ def slurper = new JsonSlurper() jsonData = slurper.parseText(JsonOutput.toJson(result))
access_token=jsonData.access_token variables.put("EVENT_HUB_ACCESS_TOKEN",access_token) println variables.get("EVENT_HUB_ACCESS_TOKEN")
expires_on=jsonData.expires_on variables.put("EVENT_HUB_ACCESS_TOKEN_EXPIRES_ON",expires_on) println variables.get("EVENT_HUB_ACCESS_TOKEN_EXPIRES_ON")

task.name: create_resource_group
task.description: A task performing a PUT request to Azure REST API in order to create a Resource Group, which name is given as input. This task requires the Azure authentication token provided the task "azure_token_for_resource_management".

variable.description: Base URL of the server or service that will be queried.
variable.name: ENDPOINT

variable.description: Path of the request (relative to the base url)
variable.name: PATH

variable.description: If true, disable SSL certificate verification
variable.name: SSL_DISABLE_CHECK

variable.description: Content-Type of the request
variable.name: CONTENT_TYPE

variable.description: A JSON parameter containing the request body.
variable.name: REQUEST_BODY

variable.description: If true, print the full request and response content in the task output.
variable.name: DEBUG

variable.description:
Format of the response, either:
  • string: plain text
  • json: a json response which will be parsed using RESPONSE_PATH
  • xml: a xml response which will be parsed using RESPONSE_PATH
  • html
    • : an html response which will be parsed using RESPONSE_PATH
  • contentView: the response will be stored in raw format, and the response content-type will be used for previewing (suitable for binary formats such as files, images, pdf documents, etc)
variable.name: RESPONSE_FORMAT

variable.description: Which data to extract in the response if json, xml or html format is selected. It uses the GPath notation
variable.name: RESPONSE_PATH

variable.description: HTTP Authorization request header that contains the credentials to authenticate the user to the server
variable.name: HEADER_Authorization

script.code:
def jarFile = new File(cachespace, "rest-assured-fat-3.3.0.jar")
forkEnvironment.addAdditionalClasspath(jarFile.getAbsolutePath())

script.code:
def jarFile = new File(cachespace, "rest-assured-fat-3.3.0.jar")
forkEnvironment.addAdditionalClasspath(jarFile.getAbsolutePath())

import groovy.json.*
// =========== Manage Azure Access token ============ def slurper = new JsonSlurper() jsonData = slurper.parseText(JsonOutput.toJson(result))
access_token=jsonData.access_token variables.put("AZURE_MANAGEMENT_ACCESS_TOKEN",access_token) println variables.get("AZURE_MANAGEMENT_ACCESS_TOKEN")
expires_on=jsonData.expires_on variables.put("AZURE_MANAGEMENT_ACCESS_TOKEN_EXPIRES_ON",expires_on) println variables.get("AZURE_MANAGEMENT_ACCESS_TOKEN_EXPIRES_ON")

script.code:
def jarFile = new File(cachespace, "rest-assured-fat-3.3.0.jar")
forkEnvironment.addAdditionalClasspath(jarFile.getAbsolutePath())

schedulerapi.connect() schedulerapi.addExternalEndpointUrl(variables.get("PA_JOB_ID"), "Azure Portal", "https://portal.azure.com/" , "/automation-dashboard/styles/patterns/img/wf-icons/azure_icon.png")
LinkedHashMap resMap = [:] resMap.put("Event Hub REST endpoint",result) resultMap.putAll(resMap)

task.name: get_namespace_state
task.description: A task performing a rest GET request. This template supports only basic authentication, for more advanced authentication settings, please modify the template according to the rest-assured documentation: https://github.com/rest-assured/rest-assured/wiki/Usage#authentication

variable.description: Base URL of the server or service that will be queried.
variable.name: ENDPOINT

variable.description: If true, disable SSL certificate verification
variable.name: SSL_DISABLE_CHECK

variable.description: If true, print the full request and response content in the task output.
variable.name: DEBUG

variable.description: Path of the request (relative to the base url)
variable.name: PATH

variable.description:
Format of the response, either:
  • string: plain text
  • json: a json response which will be parsed using RESPONSE_PATH
  • xml: a xml response which will be parsed using RESPONSE_PATH
  • html
    • : an html response which will be parsed using RESPONSE_PATH
  • contentView: the response will be stored in raw format, and the response content-type will be used for previewing (suitable for binary formats such as files, images, pdf documents, etc)
variable.name: RESPONSE_FORMAT

variable.description: Which data to extract in the response if json, xml or html format is selected. It uses the GPath notation
variable.name: RESPONSE_PATH

variable.description: Parameters of the request, provided as a JSON key/value structure. Parameters can also be specified by adding PARAM_paramname variables.
variable.name: PARAMETERS

variable.description: Additional headers of the request, provided as a JSON key/value structure. Headers can also be specified by adding HEADER_headername variables.
variable.name: HEADERS

script.code:
def jarFile = new File(cachespace, "rest-assured-fat-3.3.0.jar")
forkEnvironment.addAdditionalClasspath(jarFile.getAbsolutePath())

signalAction=variables.get("SIGNAL_ACTION")
loop = signalAction=="DELETE_EVENT_HUB" ? false : true
variables.put("SIGNAL_ACTION","")

task.name: submit_event_hub_deletion_and_wait
task.description: Submit a workflow referenced in the ProActive Catalog (or accessible by url) and wait for its termination by checking every minute if the job is terminated.

variable.description: The workflow (in ProActive catalog) to be executed when the action 'Undeploy_Event_Hub' is triggered.
variable.name: DELETE_EVENT_HUB_WORKFLOW

task.name: submit_event_sending_no_wait
task.description: Submit a workflow referenced in the ProActive Catalog (or accessible by url) without waiting for its termination

variable.description: The workflow (in ProActive catalog) to be executed when the action 'Send_Message' is triggered.
variable.name: SEND_EVENT_WORKFLOW
